page.title: 02New Forest-Camping and Deer
page.content: This area includes a site to the south of the B3055 for camping and for caravans. This is an open grassy site on the edge of woodland where it changes into moorland. From here many walks can be taken into the surrounding area, either across open moorland or along the many paths and gravel roads of the inclosures. There are well sign-posted car parks situated on the edges of the inclosures from where the day visitor can explore the vicinity. Throughout this area New Forest{ponies can be seen and in particular, there are deer, as part of these inclosures is used for{Deer Research.}The deer may be spotted if the visitor is very quiet and keeps to the pathways. Also there is an immense variety of plant, insect and bird life to be seen.
